span.strong: The Sumter School District is committed to providing a rigorous and relevant standards-based education in a safe environment. Through a partnership of students, parents, staff and community, students are given the opportunity to reach their full potential as lifelong learners and contributing members of society.

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

div.h1: Great Things Are Happening In Sumter District Schools

div.p: Governor DeSantis announced on Saturday, April 18 that Distance Learning would be our learning format for the rest of this (19-20) school year, with school buildings closed - but learning must continue, even though remotely.

a.title: Go to comments for Distance Learning

div.p: The Sumter County School Board’s Tuesday, April 21, 2020, BoardDocs® agendas are available on the Sumter District School’s Website www.sumter.k12.fl.us

a.title: Go to comments for Board Meeting.. Show More
Go to comments for Family First Coronavirus Response Act
Go to comments for Parents Q & A
Go to comments for List of Supplemental Resources

div.p: Each school has enabled a Hot Line to assist students with Distance Learning Issues which include technical support. More information provided here

a.title: Go to comments for Distance Learning / Technical Support Hotline

img.alt: Free Breakfast and Lunch, New Locations.

a.span: Free Breakfast and Lunch, New Locations.

div.p: Please select this section to see details regarding new locations for breakfast and lunch pickup.

a.title: Go to comments for Free Breakfast and Lunch, New Locations.

div.p: Sumter County Schools will be providing work at home packets that will help to maintain your Kindergarten through 2nd grade students' assignments. Work will be returned, and new work distributed, on a 2-week rotation for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. Students in grades 3-12 will be able to access all assignments through the Office portal using Teams / Class Notebook. All students should monitor their Remind accounts, for updates being sent by individual teachers.

a.title: Go to comments for Distance Learning / Work at Home

span.strong: Child Abuse: Look for the Signs

span.p: "Under Florida law, e-mail addresses are public records. If you do not want your e-mail address released in response to a public records request, do not send electronic mail regarding official business to the District or any of its employees. Instead, contact the District or individual employee by phone or in writing."

div.p: Sumter County School District is committed to ensuring that its website is accessible to people with disabilities. If you use assistive technology and are experiencing difficulty accessing information on this site, please contact the webmaster@sumter.k12.fl.us to gain access to inaccessible content or functionality of online content. To file a formal grievance under Section 504 and Title II with the District please contact David Trick, I.T. Coordinator, at 352-793-2315.
